text: You wake up strapped to a chair. A TV flickers in front of you, showing a swirling image. You hear footsteps approaching.
You fight against the straps and manage to break free. You hear voices upstairs. There’s a door to the basement and a hallway to the kitchen.
The screen’s spiral pulls you in. Your mind goes blank. You lose consciousness...
You find surgical tools and medical notes about brain transplants. You realize the operation is about to happen on you.
You see the mother preparing something at the counter. She turns slowly and smiles. You spot the keys on the table.
You wake up unable to move. A surgeon leans over you. The operation begins... Your vision fades to white.
You run until you reach the road outside the house. Blue lights appear in the distance.
They catch you before you can escape. The father injects something into your arm. You black out.
Your friend pulls up in his car — you made it! You’re safe at last. GOOD ENDING.
A regular officer finds you. They arrest you, thinking you’re the attacker. BAD ENDING.
You wake up in a different body. The operation was a success. GAME OVER.
